page.title: 06COBERLEY SCHOOL: HEADMASTER
page.content: The school was founded in 1853 by the Church of England. The Rector takes assembly once a week and the school attends church on major feast days. There are two basic classes, the juniors and the infants. The junior's ages are between 7 and 11 years, the infant's between 4 and 7 years. The social background is mainly middle class. The subjects taught are the full primary curriculum including Science and Music (violin). The school's catchment area is Coberley, Cowley, Colesbourne, Cheltenham and Leckhampton. School meals are served from their own kitchen under the County catering service. The school joins up with others for sports and music. There is fine field adequete for their size. Small school sports are played such as shinty, football, netball and cross-country.
